io.serialize

Class CellStateWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.serialize.Serializer
      • io.serialize.CellStateWriter

  • public class CellStateWriter
extends Serializer
    Writes the state of the system to a file. To avoid lots of opening and closing of files, as well as lots of panning around the disk, a single file is used for all state.

    Since disk is much slower than compute, in the future I might move this to a separate thread, with a queue of data to be appended. However, since that is a somewhat delicate piece of engineering, I will defer that until I see how much optimizing is needed.

    In the meantime, this uses the default Java BufferedWriter, which will block the thread every time it needs to write to disk.
